articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Congratulates Russian President 
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a congratulatory message to Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin on Friday. 
 The message reads as follows:
 I sincerely congratulate you on your 53rd birthday.    
 Believing that the DPRK-Russia relations of friendship and cooperation with a long history and tradition would continue to expand and develop in various fields in the future, too, I wish you good health and happiness as well as greater success in your responsible work for social stability and  prosperity and people's welfare.

Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine 
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the 60th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday handed the floral basket to Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: WPK Anniversary to Be Observed in Malta
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a congratulatory letter by the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK and doyen of the diplomatic corps, Thursday handed the floral basket and congratulatory letter to Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee.

WPK Birthday to Be Observed in Malta 
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The Maltese preparatory committee was formed in Valletta on Oct. 1 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Malta was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold celebration events such as lecture, photo exhibition and film show and the introduction of the WPK on TV on the occasion.

Rodong Sinmun Calls for Frustrating Imperialist Psychological Warfare
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The peoples of all countries aspiring after independence should heighten vigilance against the imperialists' psychological warfare and shatter their moves with a revolutionary ideological and cultural offensive, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
 The tragedies that resulted from the psychological warfare of the imperialists in recent years go to prove that countering their psychological warfare with a powerful revolutionary offensive is an important way of shattering their moves for aggression and domination and defending the sovereignty of the country and the nation, the article notes, and goes on:    
 Their psychological warfare is like a hidden dangerous sword for isolating and stifling the anti-U.S., anti-imperialist countries or bringing about the regime change there and bringing down their systems and used as a basic means of justifying their war of aggression under some pretexts and fighting it with ease.    
 The lesson taught by the Iraqi war shows that if one fails to strongly react against the imperialists' psychological warfare, one degenerates mentally and psychologically in a moment or becomes a fool offering no resistance under their jackboots. 
 If one is duped by the imperialists' psychological warfare, one abandons his faith and betrays the country and the people, blindly dancing to the tune of the imperialists.
 The United States seeks to bring down the DPRK with the above-said psychological warfare as it is countering the former's policy of strength with the toughest policy, holding high the banner of Songun. However, the U.S. psychological warfare will never work on the DPRK.

articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of various embassies here visited the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on Thursday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 At the end of the visit, they made entries in the visitor's book.
 Ioan Dedean, councilor of the Romanian embassy here, wrote that he deeply felt the profound reverence of the Korean people for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il each time he visited the exhibition.    
  Mikhail Vetrov, councilor of the Russian embassy here, and Maxim Ussov, secretary of the embassy, wrote that the flowers reflecting the reverence of the Korean people add to the significance of the 60th birthday of the WPK, a great holiday.
 Meanwhile, a friendly meeting of officials of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the above-said diplomats of embassies here was held at the Pyongyang Friendship Cultural House on the same day on the occasion.

articles.title: Greetings to Captains-Regent of San Marino
articles.content:
Increasing Number of S. Korean Children Sold Abroad
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Sale of children to foreign countries is rampant in south Korea, according to the south Korean MBC Monday. 
The number of the children adopted by other parents reached at least 13,800 and more than 8,200 of them were sold abroad from 2002 to the first half of this year. 
 This was disclosed by a paper presented by the Ministry of Health and Welfare to the "National Assembly."

articles.title: Paek Nam Sun Meets Libyan New Secretary
articles.content:
Greetings to Captains-Regent of San Marino
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Oct. 5 sent a congratulatory message to Claudio Mucioli and Antonelli Baciocchi on their election as captains-regent of San Marino.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and San Marino would continue to develop on good terms, and sincerely wished them great successes in their responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

Paek Nam Sun Meets Libyan New Secretary
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun met and conversed with New Secretary of the People's Bureau of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya to the DPRK Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah who paid a courtesy call on him on Friday.

articles.title: Ro Tu Chol Meets President of SG Automotive Group, China
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a basket of flowers and congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 They were conveyed to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, today by Nguyen Van Chau, military attache of the Vietnamese embassy here, on behalf of the military attaches corps.

articles.title: Printed Matters and CDs Introducing "Arirang" on Sale
articles.content:
Ro Tu Chol Meets President of SG Automotive Group, China
    Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol Friday met and had a talk with Li Hai Yang, president of the SG Automotive Group of China, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall in a friendly atmosphere. 
  On the occasion the president said that he would contribute to the development of the Sino-Korean relations of friendship by consolidating economic cooperation with Korea. 
 He wished the Korean people greater success in the construction of socialism.
